Package http.server

Class WebServer

java.lang.Object
http.server.WebServer
public class WebServer
extends java.lang.Object
Example program from Chapter 1 Programming Spiders, Bots and Aggregators in Java Copyright 2001 by Jeff Heaton

WebServer is a very simple web-server. Any request is responded with a very simple web-page.

The server supports GET, POST, DELETE and HEAD methods The server supports html,png,mp3,mp4,gif Codes 200, 201, 400, 404, 405, 500 are implemented

  • Constructor Details

      public WebServer()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Start the application.
      Parameters:
      args - Command line parameters are not used.

    • start

      protected void start()
      WebServer constructor. Start the server on port 3000 The server then wait for connections, get the incoming request and handle it.

    • methodGET

      protected void methodGET​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> requestHeader)
      Handle the GET request by identifying the resource needed and displaying it
      Parameters:
      requestHeader - A list of strings corresponding to the request received by the server

    • methodPOST

      protected void methodPOST​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> requestHeader, java.io.BufferedReader in)
      Fetch the information given in the POST request and create a new HTML page with them
      Parameters:
      requestHeader - A list of strings corresponding to the request received by the server
      in - The BufferedReader needed to read the information given after the POST method

    • methodHEAD

      protected void methodHEAD​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> requestHeader)
      Same as methodGET but return only the header
      Parameters:
      requestHeader - A list of strings corresponding to the request received by the server

    • displayResource

      protected void displayResource​(java.lang.String resource, java.lang.String resourceType)
      Given a resource, displays it to the user
      Parameters:
      resource - The resource path the user want to access
      resourceType - The extension of the resource (eg. html, png, mp3, gif...)

    • showPage

      protected void showPage​(java.lang.String page, java.lang.Integer code)
      Display a page html and return a header with the code
      Parameters:
      page - The path of the html page to display
      code - The code to put in the header

    • returnHeader

      protected void returnHeader​(java.lang.Integer code, java.lang.String type)
      Write the header of the response
      Parameters:
      code - The HTTP response code of the header
      type - The type of resource (MIME)

    • error404

      protected void error404() throws java.io.IOException
      Give a error 404
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs when creating the output stream or if the socket is not connected

    • error400

      protected void error400() throws java.io.IOException
      Give a error 400
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs when creating the output stream or if the socket is not connected

    • error405

      protected void error405()
      Give a error 405

    • error500

      protected void error500()
      Give a error 500
